intro: Echium onosmifolium subsp. onosmifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in dry, open habitats like grasslands and rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
